sentences.english: The Constitutional Compilation Bureau was an important organization founded in the course of constitutional reform.
sentences.chinese: 憲政編查館是在憲政改革中設立的一個重要機構。

sentences.english: It is time we settled the political reform debate once and for all.
sentences.chinese: 是時候結束這場政改辯論了。

sentences.english: How can we support the Package of Proposals which won't lead any single progressive to the democratic development of HK?
sentences.chinese: 我們怎能夠接受一個對香港民主毫無寸進的政改方案？

sentences.english: There will be no substantive concessions on the government's electoral reform proposals.
sentences.chinese: 政府不會就政改方案作出重大讓步。

sentences.english: The Awami League now has a mandate to push through constitutional changes and its sweeping reform manifesto.
sentences.chinese: 人民聯盟現在有權推行憲政改革及其全面的改革綱領。

sentences.english: The package is an improvement over the existing system.
sentences.chinese: 政改方案對比現有制度有進步。

definition: system of constitutional government/(used as an attributive) constitutional
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
chief executive of Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong or Macao)/abbr. for 特別行政區首席執行官|特别行政区首席执行官
referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]
one country, two systems (PRC proposal regarding Hong Kong, Macau and Taiwan)
abbr. for 民主建港協進聯盟|民主建港协进联盟, Democratic alliance for the betterment of Hong Kong (DAB), Hong Kong pro-Beijing party
Leung Chun-ying (1954-), 3rd Chief Executive of Hong Kong
